article.title: Flickr images temporarily disabled
article.body: Several people have reported problems with repeating images and I suspect it has something to do with the way I'm attempting to obtain random images from Flickr. I've pulled the Flickr images from the pool until I can resolve this. You still have around 650 "classic" Words That Follow images to play with in the meantime.

article.title: Rise from your grave!
article.body: So, apparently the site had been down since November, and I was completely unaware. Perhaps I should be paying a little more attention. Nah...

article.title: Player list bug fix
article.body: I have fixed a bug that was showing names in the player list incorrectly when they contained certain characters. I have also made a pretty major overhaul of the code that should be transparent to you, but if you come across any weird errors that weren't there before, please let me know.

article.title: Player cap added
article.body: I have added a player cap of 30 people until I can come up with a way to reduce the resource usage that a high number of players has been generating. Hopefully this will prevent the game from being disabled in the meantime.

article.title: Oops!
article.body: It looks like my host disabled parts of the site due to high resource usage. Unfortunately, that part of the site is required to play the game. I am working with my web host to get the resolved so I can get things up and running again.

article.title: Quiet, you!
article.body: You can now mute people in chat. To do so, simply click on the player's name on the score list. Their name will turn black and all their chat messages will vanish. Clicking the name again will undo this.

article.title: Redirection problem fixed
article.body:
I found that some devices that do not have Java capabilities were getting auto-redirected to Java's website whenever they tried to load the game. I have made a change that should prevent this from happening.

Also, the images to the right should once again display correctly in Internet Explorer

article.title: Notification sound added
article.body:
Sound has been added to the game! Well, just one sound, really. A poorly recorded, synthesized chime will now announce the beginning of new rounds. This is disabled by default and can be toggled on and off by clicking the speaker icon in the top bar. To be able to hear the sound, you will need the latest version of the Java plugin installed in your browser.

I am honestly not especially happy with the sound I have gone with, but I chose it because I couldn't get my Mario Paint composition to record decently (maybe you should be thankful for that, actually). I am open to suggestions for a better sound.

In other news, it seems I broke the "Player Caption" image on the right for those of you using Internet Explorer. If you're using IE, you should feel an overwhelming sense of shame. Even so, I will try to find a solution for you poor souls shortly.
